description: From be- (prefix meaning ‘about; abundantly; all around; all over’) +‎ grime (“to cake with dirt”).

verbs.description: begrime (third-person singular simple present begrimes, present participle begriming, simple past and past participle begrimed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To ingrain grime or dirt which is difficult to remove into (something); also (more generally), to make (something) dirty; to soil.
